The Ascendant Spellblade


Image source: https://i.pinimg.com/originals/01/4d/6b ... 1f3395.jpg


This build draft looked nice:
- Sorcerer for great spell power
- Paladin for great saves, disease/fear immunity
- RDD to boost stats, provide immunities

It has mundane 40 AB with 38 strength which can be capped at 50 strength. Blind fight/knockdown for some combat fun. 
Taunt is in the build for up to -6AC to opponents (or effective +6 AB) against low concentration opponents.
If one wants more AB, then armor skin (2 AC) can be swapped with epic prowess (1 AB).

Lvl 9 spell book Caster Level (CL) 28 ('undispellable') with silent/empower/maximise for 0-1-2-3 (ie 4 spell books of one spell like IGMS) and craft wand.
Has 376hp -> 616 (capped cons). Has EMA and EW.
Fort save 29->41 (capped con/cha) +7 against spells. 
With a few extra items can attempt to tank the dreaded devastating crits and implosions for a party, only failing on a 1 roll, 
Although for a safer approach (and far less investment) one could try to Mords + Bigby's 6-7 +  IGMS 0-1-2-3 such opponents.

Spell casting using heavy armor will be using wands initially, later on, reduced arcane spell failure equipment can be obtained (available in the environment I play-test in).
If spellsword equipment is not available, auto-still I-III can be obtained by swapping a few feats (ie silent for still, great strengths for autostill I-III) but then you don't get to have fun with the Str 38.

Similar builds (these sorc/rdd builds obtain Str 34+):
- Mick Dagger's Spellsword of Bahamut
- Revenant Mattlov's Arcane Blade of Draconic Might

None go for the class amounts in this build draft and none end up with 38->50 str, there is a trade-off for this with no auto-still III and skill points, but that is no problem in the environment this can be playtested in. I didn't put divine might/shield in the build due to Cha being 19 with 3 APR, or go for late skill dumps due to only 194 skill points but so the extra paladin levels weren't needed. No UMD but some cool paladin scrolls such as bless weapon/holy sword/death ward sound nice. I think with Breaches + Mord's spell penetration should be ok against most PvM opponents except Monks (who you will want to have your Mestil's Acid Sheath ready for).
